content:
I am writing a small program. I defined compose myself which composes 2 functions.
Then I defined a notation f \circ g. However this notation is also used by Function.comp.
Is there a way to tell lean to use my version of compose?
You can use priority to this effect. Something like notation (priority := some_number)

I tried
notation (priority := 1) g " \circ " f => compose g f
Is that the correct usage, because it does not seem to work.
It does something, namely it does not give the ambiguous error, but it uses Function.comp instead of my compose
I see the problem the priority of Function.comp was 1000 so I needed priority higher then that
alex van tilburg has marked this topic as resolved.
